content:
Yes, there are many interesting research projects that students have worked on through the University of Michigan's Undergraduate Research Opportunity Program (UROP). Here are a few examples:

1. Developing a smartphone app to help people with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) manage their symptoms.

2. Investigating groundwater contamination in areas affected by hydraulic fracturing (fracking).

3. Studying the impact of climate change on coral reefs in the Caribbean.

4. Analyzing patterns of social media use among college students.

5. Developing a method to use plant fibers as a sustainable building material.

These are just a few of the many research projects available through UROP. Students have the opportunity to work with world-renowned faculty members and gain hands-on experience in a variety of fields, from engineering to public health to the humanities.
